language.entry: A sailor's death denied ... for now.
{colour_start|pica_tan}Memories of fallen comrades inspire you to succeed{colour_end}
Memories of my former crew inspire me!
{colour_start|pica_tan}Memories of fallen comrades wrack you with guilt{colour_end}
I should had drowned with them ...
{colour_start|blue}Crystal Squawk:{colour_end} On Kill: Chance to {colour_start|healhp}Heal 0-3{colour_end} & {colour_start|stress}Destress 0-3{colour_end} Party
{colour_start|pica_tan}The Cannon's shockwave slightly lowers Party{colour_end} {colour_start|stun}Stun Resist{colour_end}
Coins from an ancient seafaring civilization have value to certain collectors.
Salvaged Wrap & Leggings, Bonded Leather Boots
Simple Wrap & Leggings, Corrected Grain Leather Boots
Cotton Wrap & Leggings, Top-Grain Leather Boots
Silk Wrap & Leggings, Full-Grain Leather Boots
Black Metal Pistols & Fine Quality Bombs

Even with one eye, the Picaroon is a deadly and deft sniper. Her armaments include bombs and a powerful cannon. Besides her explosive assets, she can retaliate using her trusty pistols. Thanks to her agility, she can adapt to a variety of party combinations. And while looting, she may be able to find rare coins. Will she find redemption ... or will she join her crew?

Even though Picaroon is capable of fighting in close quarters, she prefers fighting from afar with her pistols and tossing bombs. When dirty tricks aren't enough, she can fire a cannon. The blacksmith can adapt and improve these weapons. Accustomed to life at sea, she wears only light clothing to allow for mobility. A ripped piece of her former ship's sail is worn as a do-rag.

The Picaroon can call on her sailing experience to aid the party in several unique ways. Her old maps can lead to buried treasure and her navigator skills can scout the path ahead. She can prepare her guns, enhance her bombs to make them more devastating, or drink a scurvy ward. But, there's always time to gamble too!
{colour_start|pica_tan}When injected, shark's blood enhances poison in {colour_end}{colour_start|blight}Noxious Bombs{colour_end}
I shall finally dance the hempen jig!
It's your turn to deal this time.
Hah! you want to lose some more, fine by me!
What do you mean I was cheating last time?!
Marked cards? That's just dirt, relax...
Hmmm, there should be something interesting nearby...
Gimme a minute, I smell treasure...
Now now, let's make you clean again...
Ugh... It's no Rum, that's for sure...
Did I tell the story when we faced the biggest storm of the century...
My eye? Well that is a story to behold...
Did I ever tell you where I got this? Now that's a tale...
You should had seen this one, when it still lived.
If I apply some shark's blood ...
Hmmm, we should maybe take that route instead...
I may be able to plot a course through...
"I Will Not Dance the Hempen Jig"

A ship-wreck survivor enters the Hamlet. The Picaroon claims a giant Eldritch attacked her schooner. Her crew fought valiantly, but the ship and her entire crew were lost at sea. In the chaos, she must have swam to shore.
(Her guilt, however, prevents her from telling the real tale.)
Sea-faring adventurers arrive in the Hamlet. These Picaroons are agile, gun-toting treasure-hunting specialists, eager to make their fortune.
I am without a rudder or compass, help!
The Siren of the Sea calls to me!
We shall crash upon you like a great wave!
If only my crew were here to avenge me!
A wave may bring me under, forever.
Is it fair winds and following seas?
Sailing the open ocean is a real challenge!
Yes, I can feel the waves setting down!
The soul of our ship has been destroyed!
I am curses, fair winds do not blow for me.
You don’t know which port to sail to!
I miss sailing my ship, the wind and the water …
Borrowed time, no avoiding it now…
This vessel is in trouble I fear.
I should havebecome a carpetner instead!
Soon the above-water hull will be below!
Y-You deal with this, I.. I won't go down with you... I can not…
Shall I dorwn like my crew did?
You still don't trust me... Do You? Well... The feeling is mutual…
I knew it, you're one of them... Or maybe it's you…
Keep your eyes off me, or I'll rip them off instead!
Hahaha! More blood for the sharks!
Drown to the sea, drown to to my own blood, sailors death awaits, Hahaha!
More! Make me join them! MORE!!!
Maybe you should just stay back, useless, all of you…
If they don't take you out, maybe I should…
Mere shadow of my crew... All of you…
Just stay out of my way landlubbers!
What are you even... I'm not sharing the booty with such incompetence.
You take the front, you won't make it without me…
Should had gone down with them…
What was the point, it ends here anyway…
Pull out the plank, we are all joinign the vawes, embrace it!
Can you hear it? The dark, the deep dark, peacefull silence…
Hahaha! Drop the anchor, this is the end of our sails!
The wind and water will teach us!
Sailing a boat calls for quick action!
The deep dark calls us not yet, not today!
I triumphed the deep dark, this is nothing!
Skillful sailing ensures a prosperous voyage!
the vawes! To the rhytm of the vawes!
None escape my sight... No soul.
A strong breeze strikes my sail!
Just like in the old days, unbeatable, Hahaha!
A wise person knows how to adjust the sails to adapt!
Hah! Lets just finish this, I'll be buying the next round.
Hah! Wrap it up lads, the booty awaits…
If 30 foot waves can't stop me, nothing can!
I live... for all of you…
I'll bring them back, even if I have to cheat the death itself!
I am a stormy wind on a rough sea!
Now now, don't you go dying on me.
I won't be drinking alone tonight, not an option!
Catch the wind in your sails.
Maybe I was wrong about you... Hmph, Impressive.
You're not too bad for a landlubber.
One rule for the pirates, there is no rules…
Mates! Sails to the wind, head for victory!
On life's vast ocean diversely we sail!
Feared at all corners of the sea, you think YOU can take me on?!
The wealth awaits! And the pleasures with it!
The weather will turn against us!
There beasts in the sea that should not be distrubed!
Are you planning to crack my hull?
I am tied ot the ocean!
I will be buried at sea.
I will sail against the wind to reach my port
I will I could batten you down!
I'll adjust my own sail, thank you!
My feelings for you are like a tide giong out!
I am rough like the sea!
The wind is gone from my sails!
What if we don't find land?
We may still deplete our supplies
Drink the salty sea water, drink it up!
The compass is broken, and the stars do not shine down!
Not fooling me, I’ll cover your back...
Don't let the situation get worse!
A rising tide floats all ships.
Will the party crash upon the shore?
I will go up the pole!
I am like a ship passing in the night.
I am a rat on sinking ship.
A ship in a port is safe, but that's not what ships are for.
Am I broad in the beam?
There is salt in my blood.
Avoid the storm you cannot weather!
I could use some ale right now!
I dare you to take a shot across my bow!
You are three sheets to the wind!
You sail too close to the wind!
I am dead in the water.
There's nothing I want but plain sailing.
Our ship heeled to one side!
I remember their faces that morning …
There is no wind to aid us today.
We are not on the right track!
I don't like the cut of your jib!
Caught Between the Devil and the Deep Blue Sea
We are now scraping the bottom of the barrel.
We are all adrift. We are all at sea.
We are not shipshape and bristol fashion.
The party is getting away from me, I don't run a tight ship!
The deep water may drown me yet.
I will lash you with the lines if you don’t shut-up!
This is worse than my previous galley cook's food!
I am sown in the doldrums.
Don't leave me high and dry.
So this is our last meal, huh?
I miss my hammock on my ship/
The dungeon is too rough, like a bad sea.
I don't sleep well on the land.
I still got one healthy eye, You want it? Hahaha!
Right here, I got few drops left for all of you.
Mark my words, I will never forget!
I am island in a great blue sea!
I’ll take it lads, this flesh was just slowing me down anyway… hihihi…
Hahaha! I’m a goddess of the sea, they can’t hurt me!
Don’t worry, I’m already dead, it won’t hurt… hihihi...
I know what you really are…
Get your course straight, no lollygagging!
It's not my fault they drowned!
Something's on your back… thank me later.
I remember the sound the shipped made while cracking apart.
Swim through the ocean of pleasure and pain…
If I had stayed I would have drown!
If they won’t end it, I will…
I can remember our last morning together, the sea was still …
That bit was just in the way… hihihi.
The blood! It lures the sharks in!
Behind us, they are behind us!
We must get out of here!
I'll never forgive myself, and neither should you!
No! I still have blood in me left! Spill it!
Fill my wounds with sea water!
No! The sharks circle us… hihihi…
We'll take any port in the storm
I can't live with the guilt!
You think I'll run away? Is that what you think of me?
I should pay for what I did.
My lungs filling with water, it's what I fear!
You can't count all the waves in the ocean.
My crew may still haunt me yet.
I feel the pain, the suffering, and I don't mind it.
But I wanted to be hit! Don't you understand?
Will I ever be an admiral?
When I was young I was going to be a dancer!
Waves of the sea help me get back to me.
It's NOT my fault, it's your fault.
I don't, remember what happened during the wreck.
I don't know how I swam to shore.
Do you have any salt water taffy?
Will my crew haunt me? I am so sorry!
It's your fault if you don’t flee a sinking sink!
I can direct my own sail.
You will never put to sea if you wait for no dangers.
Take this and remember their faces!
You are dead in the water
You're an albatross around our neck
I smell the sea. Are we close to a shore?
I wonder if my eye can be replaced?
They are too fast! We must go, NOW!
We'll all end up at the bottom of the sea!
You’re missing on purpose, aren’t you!?
God made the vittles but the devil made the cook
It wasn't my fault, the attack on my ship!
I must be a mermaid, I have no fear of depths.
This is the calm before the storm
Castles made of sand fall into the sea eventually.
I fear I will lose my sea legs.
We are dead in the water.
Bring a spring upon her cable.
I will crack Jenny's tea cup.
This is a ship of fools!
I hope you miss the boat next time!
We are sailing under false colors.
I am captain of my soul.
I am master of my fate!
A smooth sea does not make a skillful sailor.
I am nautical yes, but not nice!
I will capsize us on purpose!
Maybe this one will end it…
We won’t be getting any of this out anyway…
Why are always swimming against the current?
I'll be by your side in any tide.
I am not your ship the harbor!
A life on the ocean waves is suffering.
We're gonna need a bigger boat.
Castles made of sand fall into the sea eventually
Home is where the anchor drops.
Deeper than the deep blue sea.
I have lost my courage to cross the vast unknown.
I will go down with the ship!
My heart is no longer stirred by the land.
I am full of piss and vinegar.
You can't shake the sand from you soul.
I am not fresh off the boat anymore.
She sells sea shells on the sea shore
We will end up twenty thousand leagues under the sea!
Eight bells and all is well!
It's not a long shot when I'm around!
Devil and the deep blue sea!
We are no ship of fools!
We can't circle this port forever.
Out supplies will dwindle if we waste any more time.
That cannon is stronger than my cannon!
He knows… He’s going to take me back…
Don't feel down in the doldrums
The rougher the sea, the smoother we sail
Nothing a little run can't fix!
Freeze the balls off a brass monkey
Am I flogging a dead horse?
Is it time to join my crew?
I won't get to die at sea ...
I fear the end is near.
My ship will never come in.
I will never be a bride of the sea.
You are sailing too close to the wind!
You should be taken down a peg or two!
You should be flogged over a barrel!
I miss the sun, sea, and sand.
Time and tide waits for no person.
Will you spin us a yarn?
It's never too late for love!
They will find us here! They will!
Pain fills my memories, I like to feel it burn.
You're not much of a mate!
You're as helpful as an empty crate!
I am not on an even keel
Sometimes, memory of the accident depressed me.
Of course I miss them, how can you ask me that?
Did a kraken sink my vessel?
This isn't going to end well.
Food, from you? I'll rather starve…
No! This place, it rots the food and people. Can't you see it?!
Hihihi... I'll just taste my own flesh a bit…
Whats the point? Less mess when they gut us all up…
Did they eat before the deep dark? I won't either…
I can't eat, my stomach's a jumble.
You want me to slow down?
Hihihi… The fish, they eat today, not me…
